ca.ualberta.cs.drivr

Class ElasticSearchController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.drivr.ElasticSearchController

  • public class ElasticSearchController
extends java.lang.Object
    In ElasticSearchController, the actual calls to ElasticSearch are done. This requires the use of internal classes that use asynchronous tasks in order to perform these calls, as attempts at not using them have resulted in ElasticSearch not working. The controller contains 6 classes for requests and 3 for users. For requests, it can add a request, update it, search for requests by username, by geolocation, by open requests and even delete requests. Requests are stored in a document that doesn't translate 1-to-1 with Request, requiring the use of a model class named ElasticSearchRequest used solely in this class and solely just for allowing Request to be gotten from ElasticSearch. All requests gotten will be ordered by date descending. For users, it adds and updates users using the same class, it can search for a user and it can delete a user.
    See Also:
    ElasticSearch, ElasticSearchRequest

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ElasticSearchController.AddRequest
      Here, a request is added to ElasticSearch by first building the add query for the document to be stored in ElasticSearch, then adding it into ElasticSearch, then immediately afterwards getting the ID where it's stored, appending it to the end of the add query and then replacing the query we just added with the new query including the ID.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.AddUser
      Here, the user is either added or updated (since this class handles both) in ElasticSearch by building it then adding it in the ID which is the same as the user's unique username.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.DeleteRequest
      Here, ElasticSearch will delete a request with the specified ID.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.DeleteUser
      Here, ElasticSearch will delete a user in the specified username.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.GetRequest
      Here, we get a specified request by searching with the request ID and returning it when we find it.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.GetUser
      Here, we get a user profile by searching for the unique username and returning it when we find it.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.SearchForGeolocationRequests
      Here, the program will get take in the specified geolocation from the user, search within a 5 km radius for open requests where the start and destination locations are within that range and return the gotten requests.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.SearchForOpenRequests
      Here, all open requests will be gotten from ElasticSearch by searching for those requests where the status is either pending or accepted.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.SearchForUserRequests
      Here, all requests associated to a user are gotten by checking all rider and driver usernames to see if they contain the user's username, adding them to the ArrayList and then returning that ArrayList.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.UpdateRequest
      Here, a request given by the user is updated in ElasticSearch by overwriting the document it is contained in.
